review: Not compatible with my late 2009 27" imac, something I had to dig to find out after purchasing. Ok, fine, I'll use my 2014 macbook air with appleTV, that should work right? 66 mbps down, ASUS RT66U router, air updated to most recent Yosemite iteration, and appleTV skips and chops 90 percent of the time rendering streaming unwatchable. I have to run a VOIP phone off my router in another room, so I cannot plug appleTV directly into the router via ethernet. For a while I was able to restart my computer and get the skipping to stop, but after a while that gets really, really old.  I've witnessed it work for others, but after plenty of troubleshooting I gave up. AppleTV is not always, but can be worthless for streaming. Apple needs to spend less time and money removing ports and functionality from their products, and more time in R&D; bug-testing and making quality products that work.Sent it back to amazon and went back to my tried and true method of using my dedicated beater laptop hooked up to my Smart TV via HDMI for streaming. Definitely less headache that way.
